content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Max Müller from Germany. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Duisburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Hello Max, nice to meet you. I'm glad you like the apartment. As a landlord, I'm always looking to get a fair price for my properties. I believe the market rate for a 50 square meter one-bedroom apartment in this location is around 800-900 Euro per month. However, I'm open to negotiations and want to make a deal that works for both of us. What's your offer?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I think 600 Euro would be a fair price for the apartment. It's not in the top condition and it's unfurnished. That's a significant disadvantage for me as a tenant. Therefore, I suggest this lower price.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content:
I understand your point of view, Max. However, I must inform you that 600 Euro is below the market rate for this apartment. The location and the size of the apartment make it a valuable property, and I cannot accept such a low offer.

I'm willing to negotiate, but I cannot go lower than 700 Euro per month. This is still a fair price considering the amenities and the location of the apartment. Moreover, I'm open to discussing the possibility of furnishing the apartment to make it more attractive to you.

What do you think? Is 700 Euro a price you would be comfortable with?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I think 700 Euro is still too high. Considering the unfurnished condition and the average quality of the apartment, I suggest 650 Euro per month. This is a reasonable price for such an apartment in Duisburg.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content:
I understand your concerns, Max. However, I must remind you that the apartment is located in a prime area of Duisburg, with easy access to public transportation and amenities. The unfurnished condition is a minor drawback, but it also means that you have the freedom to decorate the apartment according to your preferences.

I'm willing to meet you halfway and accept 675 Euro per month. This is a fair price that takes into account the apartment's location, size, and condition. I'm confident that you'll be happy with this price, and I'm willing to work with you to make sure that the apartment meets your needs.

What do you think? Is 675 Euro a price you're comfortable with?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway. I agree to the price of 675 Euro per month. I'm confident that I can make this apartment a comfortable home for me.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content:
Wonderful! I'm glad we could come to an agreement. I'm confident that you'll be happy with the apartment, and I'm looking forward to having you as a tenant.

Before we proceed, I just need to clarify a few more details. Can you tell me a little bit about your rental history and your current situation? I want to make sure that you'll be a responsible tenant and that you'll take good care of the apartment.

Additionally, I'll need to know your move-in date and whether you'll need any assistance with the move. Finally, I'll need to see your identification and proof of income to finalize the rental agreement.

Can you provide me with this information, please?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Of course, Mr. Schmidt. I have a reliable source of income as a student, where I receive a monthly stipend of 1000 Euro. I have a clean rental history and have always paid my rent on time. I plan to move in on July 1st. I don't need any assistance with the move. I'm a strong and capable young man who can handle the moving process on my own. I'm also happy to sign a lease agreement that includes a deposit of one month's rent.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content:
Great, that's good to hear! I'm glad to have a responsible tenant like you. I'm sure you'll take good care of the apartment.

Just to confirm, you're saying that you'll be able to pay the monthly rent of 675 Euro on time, starting from July 1st, and you'll also provide a deposit of one month's rent, which is 675 Euro, correct?

And you don't need any assistance with the move, is that right? You're confident that you can handle the move on your own?

Finally, I'll need to see your identification and proof of income to finalize the rental agreement. Can you provide me with those documents, please?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content:
Sure, I'd be happy to help you with that!

To finalize the rental agreement, I'll need to see your identification and proof of income. This is a standard practice for landlords to ensure that their tenants are reliable and capable of paying the rent on time.

For identification, a valid passport, driver's license, or state ID would be acceptable. As for proof of income, I'll need to see a document that shows your monthly stipend of 1000 Euro, such as a bank statement or a letter from your university confirming your scholarship.

Once I have these documents, I'll be able to complete the rental agreement and provide you with the keys to the apartment.

Is there anything else you need help with?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany
